body_html: Good idea. But this is easy to implement using tf.string_split in your input_fn. I think adding one more argument to the api will add complexity without adding much value. What do you think? If you want to use a dense Tensor, multi_label_head supports multi-hot tensor of shape [batch_size, n_classes].
body_text: Good idea. But this is easy to implement using tf.string_split in your input_fn. I think adding one more argument to the api will add complexity without adding much value. What do you think? If you want to use a dense Tensor, multi_label_head supports multi-hot tensor of shape [batch_size, n_classes].
body: Good idea. But this is easy to implement using `tf.string_split` in your `input_fn`. I think adding one more argument to the api will add complexity without adding much value. What do you think? If you want to use a dense `Tensor`, `multi_label_head` supports multi-hot tensor of shape `[batch_size, n_classes]`.
